info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 7:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Perquimans and southern Chowan Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 743 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Snug Harbor, or near Hertford, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Rain 2 to 3 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding of roads and low lying areas can be expected. Locations impacted include... Hertford, Winfall, Valhalla, Snug Harbor, Drummond Point, Mavaton, Saint Johns, Hancock, Yeopim Station, Beach Springs, Light Nixon Fork, Macedonia and Somerset. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
